tif

Class TagValueConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • tif.TagValueConverter

  • public final class TagValueConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for converting EntryIFD values to human-readable or numeric forms, using hint-aware transformation rules.
    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor Description
      private TagValueConverter()
      Default constructor is unsupported and will always throw an exception.

    • Method Detail

      • toStringValue

        public static java.lang.String toStringValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Converts the value of an IFD entry into a string, applying any hint-based interpretation.

        This method handles the following cases:

        • Number or Byte → string form of the number
        • String → trimmed string (parsed as a date if TagHint.HINT_DATE)
        • RationalNumber → simplified fraction string
        • byte[] → interpretation depends on the TagHint:
          • TagHint.HINT_STRING → UTF-8 null-terminated string
          • TagHint.HINT_BYTE → concatenation of byte values
          • TagHint.HINT_MASK → literal "[Masked items]"

        If the value is not one of the above supported types, this method throws IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object
        Returns:
        the string representation of the entry’s value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the entry’s value type cannot be converted

      • toNumericValue

        public static java.lang.Number toNumericValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Converts the value of an IFD entry into a numeric form.

        If the entry's data is a Number, it is returned directly. Otherwise, it will throw an IllegalArgumentException to signal that the entry does not contain a numeric value.

        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object
        Returns:
        the numeric value as a Number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the entry does not contain a numeric value
